headline: Easiest Eggnog
description: This easy homemade eggnog flavored with vanilla and a dash of nutmeg comes together in just 5 minutes with 5 simple ingredients for a festive drink.
name: Easiest Eggnog

recipeInstructions.text: Blend together milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a large pitcher until well combined. Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

review.reviewBody: I found this was lacking in flavor. I tried tweaking it a few ways but it did not help
Tastes like what my mom used to make every Christmas when I was a child. I used to make it for my kids, but they are all grown up and I have forgotten how to make it.
The real deal. I like to use vanilla bean and a splash of Spiced Rum.
We love this Eggnog recipe, but I did add more nutmeg and an extra egg, I use whole milk. I make it ALL season long (several times), don't buy it anymore. thank you ALLRECIPES.

I felt the same as many about this recipe. It's a good starting point but you may have to do some tweaking of the recipe for your taste. I decreased the milk to 2 cups and used whole milk, added another 1/2 tablespoon of sugar and added a 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon. We'll continue to play with this recipe but it does taste great.

I made two batches. I made the first batch exactly as the recipe states except I had to substitute alternative milk for regular cow's milk and we didn't have any nutmeg. The alternative milk flavor came through way too strong so for my second batch I used some of the ideas in the comments. The second time I put two whole eggs in a bowl, whipped those lightly, added one cup of creamy oatmilk and one cup of heavy whipping cream, 3 tablespoons of sugar, 1 teaspoon baking vanilla, a dash of salt, and a generous sprinkling of cinnamon. I blended it with a stick blender for one minute. It turned out great.
i added some cinnamon and it was super good
I used heavy cream for 1/2 the liquid and tossed everything into blender. It frothed up perfect, but it's the background flavor of added rum or whiskey that makes it so good!

Used 1 2/3 cup Oat Milk and 2/3 cup Heavy Cream. Was a tad thin but good flavor.
Will add some cool whip on top.

I thought it tasted more like melted vanilla ice cream, so after a taste test, I added one more egg, nutmeg, a dash of sea salt, and cinnamon (like other reviewers did) and that really made it taste like eggnog. when I make it again, I'll do 1 egg to 1 c milk - gives it that traditional creamy golden color too. I put all ingredients in my Ninja and hit the blend button - easy peasy, perfect (does need to settle a bit if you don't want a lot of foam).
Great, light and easy eggnog I even put a little brown sugar instead of white and it was awesome. Make sure to mix well I used a hand mixer for about 30-45 seconds.

I saw the comments about the consistency of this and with these modifications, I was very pleased with the outcome. I added 1/2 package of vanilla pudding, substituted the 2.3 cups of milk with 1 cup of milk, 1 cup of half and half and 1/3 cup of heavy cream. I also used three eggs instead of two. A quick and delicious recipe, plus some rum....

I just tried it a few minutes ago because I had a craving for some quick and easy eggnog. overall I thought it was good but I think next time I’m going to add a little bit more sugar and a little bit more flavor but I mean overall I give it a four out of five.
easy recipe. reduced the sugar by one tblsp. added rum. tasty.
We didn't have enough milk, so we used 2 parts milk , one part heavy cream, one part buttermilk. it was DELICIOUS!

It was easy to make and tasted ok. The nutmeg really makes a difference so use slightly more than a dash imo. My main issue is it wasn't thick enough. My father used to make it for me, and it was thick and not watery at all. And unlike "thedailygourmet" recommendation to use sweet condensed milk to thicken it, my father didn't use anything other than regular milk and eggs. I have never had egg nog that wasn't thick. Other people I know have made it thick, and the supermarket-bought stuff is thick as well. This is the first time I have had egg nog that wasn't thick. So I suppose the next time I make this, I'm going to adjust the eggs and milk to find the balance I desire.
My husband loves this he likes drinking it with brandy the only thing I did different was I use whole milk it made it richer and creamer
I had to add a little less milk and only 1 tbs of sugar because it was too sweet and not thick at all. Added some cream too.

I read a comment about someone tasting egg chunks in their drink, and despite my best to beat the eggs I still found chunks in my mixture to test it. A sifter works in taking out most (if not all) of the egg chunks, though and it tastes great! I'm not very familiar with eggnog so I can't attest to how much it tastes like eggnog but it was a nice drink!
I put it in the fridge to make it thick
I used almond milk yum! And I don't have to wait until the Holidays to get eggnog.
Loved it! The only thing I changed was the nutmeg to cinnamon!
I made it also. Just had to increase amounts of some ingredients for my family’s taste

It was bland as is. I made another batch which I fixed up a bit by adding whole milk, more nutmeg, a dash of clove, cooking it to presimmer to thicken and then added a bit more vanilla after cooling. And strained just incase. It came out more rich and creamy.
My grandma and I used to make this when I was like 12 years old I love this recipe

This "Easiest Egg Nog" recipe is a good basic recipe for egg nog. I tried to reduce the sweetener, as is my habit, but found that I needed the full amount for a good-tasting egg nog. Thank you sal for sharing your recipe.

SO good. SO quick. SO tasty. I was reading an old mystery novel where a doctor whips up some eggnog for a patient and I noticed the eggs were not cooked so I looked for a similar recipe. Had this on a hot summer day and didn't find it too rich!
Delicious! Add a little cinnamon and whipped cream and it's perfect!

Hubby and I both really liked this. We followed the recipe almost exactly, but did put in a cup of heavy cream in place of some of the milk because I like things creamy. It tasted great, and was such a fun treat!
The flavor is great for a little added thickness I used 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream 1/2 cup half and half and the rest milk. Flavor is amazing and it’s think but it’s delicious!
It was delicious... just needed a lil bit of cinnamon... I'd say a tsp...
The store had no cream, or already made eggnog, so I tried this. It really needs heavy cream. It' s not terrible, but i'll not make it again.

Yes, if you are an egg nod aficionado there may be better, more exciting recipes, but this recipe really packs the punch. It is good right after it is made but so much better when left to chill over night. We substituted cinnamon for the nutmeg.

My husband and I loved it. I used whole milk and replaced a cup of the milk with one cup of heavy whipping cream. I also had to add a couple of dashes of nutmeg as the cream covered the nutmeg flavor somewhat. We will used this one again!
it was as as according to the name easiest egg nog to make-loved it
It not as thick and heavy as store bought, but it is way better. Next batch I am substituting the nutmeg for pumpkin spice.
This is amazing, I love eggnog! I added a little too much vanilla but it still tasted great! Me and my family loved it so much.
This is amazing, I love eggnog! I added a little too much vanilla but it still tasted great! Me and my family loved it so much.
It was delisous and easy to make it
No changes. It taste like mildly eggnog flavored milk. While it is very thin, the thin texture wasn't the problem, it just lacked enough flavor. I drank about half a cup and threw it out.

I LOVE this eggnog. I've made ones where they called for cooking and had different spices and never liked the texture or the taste. At first, I was very skeptical about the vanilla pudding being weird, but I've decided it's what makes the taste and texture right. The longer you leave it in the refrigerator, the thicker it gets. On Weight Watcher's Freestyle an 8 ounce serving is only 4 points. You can't buy that at a store!

This is a keeper. And even held up to us spiking it with birthday cake vodka ;-)
Y.U.M...!!

Meh. This was okay. Really thin compared to any eggnog I've made or drank before, whether it was homemade or store bought. It just didn't do it for me. But the 8-year-old who attended my Thanksgiving really enjoyed this, as did one other adult.

Easy and it satisfies my need for holiday 'nog.

I used regular milk, inadvertantly, so it may have tasted even creamier... I'd do it the same the next time.

I also added a pinch of sea salt.

Biggest pro: very easy and simple to make.

Cons: Not very flavorful. Next time, I'm going to add another egg, more vanilla, and thicken it up by replacing some of the milk with cream.

My husband waits for fall to roll around every year to buy eggnog. I made this for him today and he said he will never go back to store bought again. 
I didn't have whole milk so I used 2 cups of 2% milk, and 1/3 cup of heavy whipping cream. Added a smidge more nutmeg.
Blended the eggs first in his ninja bullet and then added other ingredients, blended on Blend IQ for 2 cycles. 
Super amazing, and fresh tasting. 
Not worried about the raw eggs, but if you are you can temper them with heated milk and cook them over steam. Enjoy.
its good warm too

This is the recipe I used as a teenager. I would whip this up in the blender for breakfast almost every school day. I just started adding Matcha tea to my low carb diet and have been making frappucinos but I ran out of collagen protein powder so it occurred to me to use an egg instead. Then I thought egg nog and found this recipe. Needless to say, I added 1 tsp Matcha to this and substituted coconut mile and heavy cream for the milk and added several ice cubes. I cannot tell you how good it tastes!!

I only enjoy hot eggnog. So I avoided any concerns with raw egg by combining everything in the blender and then heating on the stove until 140°, hot but not boiling. Add rum and it is the best winter cocktail ever.
will make again. I recommend adding a dash of Carmel extract
I didn't realize how easy it was to make. I have been buying store bought for years. This is good, I will make it again.
Easy and delicious! I added ice because I like a very cold egg nog. This also thins it out a bit- which I prefer.
We used unsweetened almond milk and we love it! We don't like a thick eggnog, so it was just right and so easy to make. You have to blend the eggs first and all the other ingredients thoroughly.

It was pretty great, and I added an extra egg for thickness and I cooked it with starch after blending it. Then, I added a bit of cinnamon, nutmeg, and milk and blended it again. Have to agree with the people who say that it's too much like vanilla milk thing but still, overall, simple, easy, good, but could use more egg. Thanks for the recipe!

Just like I remember it growing up! So easy and delicious. Kids love it. You might try a dash of cinnamon to replace the nutmeg. We did and love it even more. If you do it correctly and understand how a hand mixer works or even a blender, you won't find egg chunks in your drink. Quite a simple process actually.
Made double and used full cream milk, added a banana and 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream. YUM
Made this without the rum, every couple sips I hit slimy bits of egg. Not for me.
It's quick, it's easy, but iI didn't like it.
Not as good tasting as store bought eggnog. Seems to need more egg. It was ok.
Delicious!! Love easy recipes.

Why have I been buying egg nog all these years?! My kiddos wanted to toast egg nog for New Years but every store was sold out. I make so many things from scratch so I figured it would be silly not to try this. Boy, am I glad I did! I used 2 cups of 2% milk, 1/4 cup white sugar, and cut down on the vanilla as I have very pure extract.
I'm never buying eggnog in a carton again! So easy, fabulously delicious and none of the odd too thick texture you get with the store bought stuff.

Fantastic and fast!
Made this recipe with sweetened condensed milk...family loved it.

Followed recipe to the letter. Epic failure. Using milk for an eggnog recipe is a BAD idea. Grt intention I'm sure not such a grt idea however. Consistency is too thin and flavor is overpowered by milk.
I have had better and made better, cant find my recipe back was hoping this would be close.
Made it tonight and loved it. Didn't have nutmeg so subbed cinnamon, so a different flavor, but just sweet and thick enough. Will try again with nutmeg and rum flavoring.

I prefer eggnog on the thick side so I utilized some of the recommendations from other reviewers: added 1/4 c. of vanilla instant pudding, and a couple of ice cubes. Although these additions helped to thicken it a bit, It was still on the thinner side, With a "few" dashes of nutmeg and cinnamon to taste. I got it to the point that i really liked the flavor. Next, I will put it in the freezer and re-blend to see how thick that makes it.
try 1/2 tsp cinnamon instead of nutmeg
I added an extra egg because it kind of just tasted like sweetened milk. I also added extra nutmeg. It was as thick as you could expect from eggnog with no cream in it.
Does it taste like Eggnog? No.... Does it taste like Vanilla MIlk? Yess! Bingo.... Not what I was looking for at all!

I first made the recipe as written using fresh eggs from my farm. It was way better than any store-bought nog. I now make single servings by halving the recipe and just shaking everything in a tumbler. Very quick, easy, and delicious.

So quick and easy to make. I made it with whole milk, and substituted cinnamon for the nutmeg because that is what I had on hand. It tasted great for such a quick and simple recipe. I will be making it again.
I definitely will make it again. I recommend using a blender or something of that sorts. Unless you like chunks of eggs. It was fantastic. It almost tasted like ice-cream! It was amazing. Yummy!!!!

Delish! For all of those who had a bad experience, here's a tip to help!
1. Beat the eggs first, and completely smooth with an electric beater with a whisk attachment or the regular beaters, or make sure you beat it completely smooth by hand with a whisk.
2. Add in the sugar to the eggs and mix it well for about a minute.
3. Add everything else and it's super smooth with no egg chunks!(: 

Thank you for this recipe! Simple and yummy!

It wasn't as creamy as I would have liked, so I put a third egg in there, and also replaced the sugar with maple syrup(with a little extra thrown in there for fun. The result was super good and creamy and maple-y
The recipe is good the only thing I did was add instant pudding the whole packet like jello the only flavor I had was cheesecake but I'm sure vanilla will thicken it right up.

I'm sure there are other variations of this age old recipe...but it takes me straight back to my childhood. My mom would make this for us and it was always a treat. My favorite part was the bubbly milk mustache...yep, when I'm alone, I still do it. I think she added just a touch more sugar. To me this tastes a lot like a melted McDonald's vanilla shake...but oh so good.

This "Easiest Egg Nog" recipe is a good basic recipe for egg nog. I made mine with almost-flavorless neutral-tasting unsweetened dairy-free SO DELICIOUS ® coconut-milk beverage (instead of regular diary milk), and substituted the sugar with honey. I tried to reduce the sweetener, as is my habit, but found that I needed the full amount for a good-tasting egg nog. Thank you sal for sharing your recipe.

Very quick recipe with good flavor & consistency. If you want a thicker eggnog, separate the eggs. Beat the whites until they have peaks. Beat the egg yolks until they are light yellow. Then blend the two together slowly and carefully. You will not have problems with "egg chunks" if you use fresher eggs. Because this is a raw product, I personally recommend organically certified eggs. The eggsafety.org can help you source fresh, safe eggs.

Being an Australian, this was my first ever attempt at egg nog at Christmas and I have to say the recipe is great!
I have nothing to compare this to however, I will concede that I almost trippled the booze content (monkey shoulder whiskey) so that I could taste the kick. 
Will definitely make this again!
Yummy. I made mine with almond milk and stevia, still yummy.

I just made it tonight because my papa ran out of eggnog store bought. I did not have nutmeg so I used cinnamon instead but it tasted good. I would give it four stars not because it is not good, just not the BEST THING EVER, I loved it though!
I like that this recipe makes an egg nog that is thinner and not as sweet as the store bought version. We added rum to half the batch. Delicious !

We loved this! I whipped it up in five minutes and my entire family (husband, 2- and 4-year-olds) devoured it. We topped it with some whipped cream and I look forward to making it again with some thicker ingredients (at my husband's request) and some alcohol for some extra holiday "cheer." Ha!
This is my 1st time ever to make Egg Nog....if I knew how easy it would be I would have saved hundreds of dollars on store bought over the years ....thank you Allrecipes for the great recipe !!!!

I read some reviews before making this, which led me to taking some extra steps, then I personalized it a little bit. For a 5 minute egg nog, not bad!

Since I only had imitation vanilla on hand, I ended up using 1 TBS. I only drink non-fat milk, which was too thin here, so I took someone's advice and added ice cubes. I also whisked the eggs very well before adding them to the blender. Used 1/2 sucralose 1/2 sugar.

I taste-tested, and found that a pinch of nutmeg didn't make a dent, and nutmeg alone, for me, doesn't work. So I added 1/8 tsp each of nutmeg, cinnamon, ground cloves, ginger and allspice, a/k/a pumpkin spices or molasses cookie spices. They are my favorites, always have them. I could've put more in, but subtle's okay tonight.
Used pasteurized eggs instead of fresh eggs
Quick. Simple. Delicious. A nice treat on a December evening.
I like it when I use my bullet to blend it because the bullet really leaves no chunks of egg, however, I would like it a little thicker, wonder if one more egg would do that? PWR.
So yummy. I love eggnog and have always wanted to make it homemade. Finally did today thanksgiving 2014 so delish

Was pretty good. Very thin. Didn't taste much like store bought egg nog at all, more like vanilla nutmeg milk... But I like those flavors so it was still good. Will search for another more traditional recipe to satisfy my eggnog craving.
Tried this tonight. A little thinner than store bought but still good.
it is kinda thin
this is a very good eggnog I just made it and I made some cookies too. I think this is what we are going to put out for Santa this year.

Just made it, I'm drinking my first glass as I type. It is very good, and it would be 5 stars except that it is not as thick as I like my egg nog. However, it tastes great, and I will probably make it again. Thank you
I didn't really care for this it didn't taste like real egg nog to me.
Very tasteful! Will be keeping this recipe in my box.
Amazing! I put it in the microwave to kind of cook the eggs. It tastes so good, it makes store bought eggnog look horrible. Gotta make this for the family :)
